thread.title: Gulf Premiership Rugby: Bahrain routs Muscat
thread.title_full: Gulf Premiership Rugby: Bahrain routs Muscat

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Gulf Premiership Rugby: Bahrain routs Muscat
text:
Gulf Premiership Rugby: Bahrain routs Muscat Action from the match between Muscat and hosts Bahrain in Saar Muscat Daily staff writer October 05, 2015 
The visiting Muscat Rugby Football Club team suffered a 5-55 rout at the hands of Bahrain Rugby Football Club in a Gulf Premiership match in Saar, Bahrain on Friday. 
Upbeat after their 26-0 win over Kuwait Scorpions in their opening match, the Muscat players had high hopes of giving the hosts a good fight. 
However, the hosts ran in eight tries as they trounced the visiting Muscat side. 
A hat-trick from Toby Borrow and further tries from Oli Luke, Adam Wallace, Dave Moore, Henry Frost and Luke Radley did the damage. Radley also contributed 15 points with the boot. 
Muscat now travels to Doha, Qatar to take on Doha 2 for its third match of the league on October 9. 
The Gulf Premiership is a competition featuring five teams, with the matches being played on a home-and-away basis. It is an entry level meet for new West Asian rugby clubs aspiring to vie for the West Asia title. 
Muscat, Bahrain, Doha 1, Doha 2 and Kuwait's Q8 Scorpions are the five teams in fray this year. Similar content
